titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the William G. Butler Photography Collection
1875-2015
PR 425
titlestmt.author: Sydney Bebon

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-25 10:00:59 -0400.

physdesc.extent: in five boxes and one flat folder.

did.abstract: The William G. Butler photography collection, collected by William G. Butler, consists primarily of photographs of New York City from 1890-2015. The earliest document in the collection, from 1875, is a page from an Ulster County atlas.
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: In this collection each item is arranged first by date in chronological order, then by title in alphabetical order. Although oversized photographs are housed separately from the rest of the collection, they are arranged by the previously stated parameters.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: This photography collection was created by William G. Butler, art and photography collector. He has also donated part of his collection to the Palm Springs Art Museum, which showed a curation of his donations in a 2019 exhibit "Contemporary Sublime: The Photographic Collecting of William G. Butler".

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to qualified researchers by appointment only.

Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact printroom@nyhistory.org prior to your research visit to coordinate access. Keep in mind that it will take between two (2) and five (5) business days for collections to arrive, and you should plan your research accordingly.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift, estate of William G. Butler, 2021.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The collection should be cited as: William G. Butler photography collection, PR425, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Sydney Bebon in June 2021.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The William G. Butler photography collection consists primarily of vintage photographs of New York City collected by Butler. Many of the photographs were taken for publication and originally owned by newspicture agencies or press associations. The content of the photographs is varied, however many are views of cityscapes or street scenes and city life. The majority of the photographs are silver gelatin prints. While some artists are known, the collection does not consist of a series by any particular artist. Many of the photographs seem to have been titled by a third party rather than the photographer and are bracketed in this finding aid to distinguish them as later additions. The collection also includes a small number of non-photographic pictorial works. The container list includes a complete item level inventory of the collection.

controlaccess.subject: Street photography -- New York (State) -- New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Atlas pages 45 and 46. Page 45: complete map of Olive, New York; Page 46 is one-half of a spread of Ulster County. Authored by F.W. Beers, Superintendant, published by Walker and Jewett.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed later in 1960.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed later in the 1950's. While the photographer is unknown, the photo originates from Ewing Galloway's photography agency.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph, printed later, features 161st street between Amsterdam and St. Nicholas Avenues. The picture is stamped and signed on the back, however the name of the artist is unclear.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed in the 1950's. While the photographer is unknown, the photo originates from Ewing Galloway's photography agency.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photographer is Eugene de Salignac. It appears to have been taken for or in the possession of the New York Post, which is stamped on the back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photograph seems to have originally been the possession of Air France and published in their "Tele-Magazine" as noted on the back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph, printed later, features two people with street vending boxes hanging from their necks as they warm their hands over a fire.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pictures Nassau Street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed later.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: While the photographer is unknown, the picture appears to have been in the possession of the New York Evening Post in which it was published (as noted on the back).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photograph is attributed to ACME NEWSPICTURES and includes a caption on the back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed later.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accredited to the New York Post.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed later.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph features a crowd gathered outside a crime scene on 138th street. Accredited to ACME NEWSPICTURES.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph was taken by Lou Stoumen in 1940 and printed in 1986. It was previously held by the Milwaukee Art Museum and Floyd and Josephine Segel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accredited to ACME NEWSPICTURES. Caption on the back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph features Central Park.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph features a crowd of evacuees after a chlorine gas explosion. Accredited to ACME NEWSPICTURE INC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Taken by Charles Langer at ACME NEWSPICTURE INC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Taken by David McLane and accredited to ACME NEWSPICTURE INC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Taken by David McLane and accredited to ACME NEWSPICTURE INC.

scopecontent.p: This photograph, taken and printed in the 1960's, pictures the 59th Street Bridge/Ed Koch Queensboro Bridge

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph features the releasing of balloons by Johnny Maguire and Mariann Kelly for the March of Dimes Campaign.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accredited to United Press International Photo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pictures Chelsea during a blackout.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pictures Orchard Street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The photograph, printed later, pictures a street vendor with his merchandise (fur coats). The picture signed on the back by the artist, Ave Pildas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph by Michael DeChellis, signed on the back. Taken in 1976, this photograph was printed later.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph by Chris Bliss was taken in 1997 but printed later.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph features a neon sign from which the title of the photograph is derived. The photograph is printed with archival pigment and signed by the artist John Dubois.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph, featuring a cafe, is signed by the artist Jim M Kimmin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This publication features pictorials of Times Square by various artists over various periods. The material is presented in a magazine-like form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph of Triborough Bridge is signed by the artist Francesca Ifilligi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This photograph features an aerial view of the New York skyline. The photograph was taken by Jon Hughes and is accredited as a press photo on the back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contemporary, features urinals and graffiti.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of NYC skyline.
